alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Okeechobee, southwestern Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yeehaw Junction, or 8 miles southwest of Blue Cypress Lake, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Drum and Yeehaw Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
